title: Mk JOGO

replies.body:
Best to remove the 3rd party app. Although you may not abuse the other functions it comes with, Riot is unable to monitor if you only use the offline skins or other functions. In the meantime, ask MK Jogo to talk to Riot to get approval on their systems in order to play safe. 

With the end of season nearing, would you rather get banned and lose rewards or keep tempting fate?

Your call ultimately...

ty lad, that's the type of answer I wanted from my last post...much appreciated
guys when i heard the new i deleted mk jogo but i applied a cursor and now i want to change my cursor to normal.Can you help me pls?
i still want a reply from riot tho, so I'm going to continue to bump this

Hope this can help.. I can quote the post directly for the EUW forums but here. its a reply to someone asking the same question as you and luckily you got a warning and not a perma ban

Riot Eambo (EUW)  - 4 months ago

"Does it interfere with the ingame experience?" - Yes
"Does it provide an unfair advantage over other players without this tool?" - Yes

There's two very simple questions that answer yours. Whether you think a feature should or should not be available, if it's not available and you're using it, it's an unfair advantage.

A program that shortens the amount of work you have to do, or even that moves timers from the tab area to another area, is an unfair advantage. Other players do not have this, and it does infact give you a benefit over others - whether it's as simple as not having to press tab, or as complicated as automatically moving your character - all unfair advantages that interact with the game are just that.

Declined (Wrecchman) (EUNE)  - 4 months ago

You actually got a warning? WOW!

Lucky bloke you are!!!
Over the last few weeks, there have been a number of posts on the boards from people who received permanent bans as a result of having used MK Jogo, or even having it installed.

But as Eambo mentioned any program that interact with your in game experience is a complete no go, as it gives you an unfair advantage no matter how small or big it is.

Given that the Risk team thought it necessary to send you a warning, it's safe to assume that they consider MK in the way you are using it to be in breach of third party app policy.

I'm no expert on 3rd party app policy, but my hunch on these two points of use are:

* The in game cursor can't be modded through Riot supported means and could theoretically be used to gain an advantage over other players through greater clarity.

* The pre-written chat macro allows a 20 character message to be sent to other players with just two keyboard actions, so could be considered as giving an advantage over other players when communicating key info or suggesting tactics.

There is no "list" of apps or functions that are considered allowed or disallowed as such a list would be impossible to keep up to date. So all policy is essentially guided by the following principle:

**No software should interfere directly with the in-game player experience between when you press “Play” and the end of game screen.**

For more info on 3rd party app policy, check out our last message on the topic [here](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/miscellaneous/5kx4F7VE-reminder-third-party-applications).
